newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish PM says Russia will accept NATO growth.
newsitem.headline: Polish PM says Russia will accept NATO growth.

text.p: Poland's prime minister said Russia and NATO might finalise details on Tuesday of an agreement that would imply Moscow's acceptance of the Western pact's enlargement.

Premier Wlodzimierz Cimoszewicz said it was possible that the text of an agreement could be finally settled during a meeting in Luxembourg between Russian Foreign Minister Yevgeny Primakov and NATO Secretary-General Javier Solana.

"This fact alone is very significant, as not long ago the Russian leaders claimed that basically they were not interested in any agreement with NATO," Cimoszewicz told Polish public radio in an interview on Tuesday.
"The agreeing of such an understanding means the de facto acquiescence of Russia to the expansion of the pact," added Cimoszewicz, whose country threw off Soviet domination in 1989
